meanings.definition: Capable of being moved from its usual place.
meanings.sent1: The heavy box was too displaceable for the small child to lift.
meanings.sent2: The displaceable chair was easily rearranged to make more space in the room.
meanings.sent3: The displaceable toy car kept rolling away from the toddler, making him chase after it.
meanings.sent4: Her displaceable thoughts wandered from one idea to another, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent5: The displaceable sand shifted with each step, leaving footprints behind.

meanings.definition: Able to be replaced or removed.
meanings.sent1: The displaceable battery in the remote control needed changing.
meanings.sent2: The displaceable light bulb was easily swapped out for a new one.
meanings.sent3: The displaceable sticker on the book peeled off without leaving any residue.
meanings.sent4: His displaceable role in the play could be filled by another actor if needed.
meanings.sent5: The displaceable flower in the vase was replaced with a fresh bloom.

meanings.definition: Subject to being displaced or moved.
meanings.sent1: The displaceable sandcastle was washed away by the incoming tide.
meanings.sent2: The displaceable furniture in the room had to be shifted to accommodate the new carpet.
meanings.sent3: The displaceable marker on the map kept getting smudged by accident.
meanings.sent4: Her displaceable emotions were easily influenced by the mood of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The displaceable clouds drifted lazily across the sky, changing shapes as they moved.
